intro: Vernonanthura stellaris, commonly known as the starry vernonberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, elliptical leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
